item.title: Report E-2024060246
item.description:
Report E-2024060246

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: SOUTHINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading freight forklift operator had the forkblades on the forklift too high and as a result punctured one of the boxes when they went to pick up the freight consequently puncturing an inner container contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled mater was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured box and inner container.

item.title: Report X-2024060617
item.description:
Report X-2024060617

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: HARTFORD
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EMPLOYEE CALLED FOR LEAKER AT 308 ON THE BELT. RESPONDER DONNED PPE AND WENT TO THE LOCATION. THE LOADER TOLD RESPONDER THAT HE PICK UP THE BOX AND FELT THAT IT WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM. RESPONDER INSPECTED THE PACKAGE AND FOUND IT WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM. RESPONDER PLACED IT IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND BROUGHT IT TO THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2024060060
item.description:
Report X-2024060060

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-01
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The box is marked with a corrosive diamond. The side of the box is wet and ripped open. The box is wet from the leaking 1X1 Gal bottle of Carbon Buster. All the bottles came out of the box. 1 bottle is crushed causing it to leak. The other bottles are soiled from the leakage.
